alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 12:57AM CST until January 27 at 12:52PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Chambers and Liberty Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Trinity River...including Moss Bluff...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Speaks, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding along the Lavaca River reaches hundreds of yards into the lower floodplain backing up sloughs and low areas. Minor roads and near the river flood and livestock are isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM CST Thursday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 24.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.0 feet on 05/30/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Lavaca River Edna 21.0 18.9 Thu 12 am CS 24.0 21.2 16.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CST.
